data.title: Local beats
data.text:
Radio DJ: Charly "Gumbo Charly" Lukhardt

Radio station: WSLR 96.5 LP-FM (wslr.org)

Name of program: "Hot Tea with Gumbo," "Radio Gumbo"

When to listen: Wednesdays 7-9 a.m.; 3-5 p.m.

When started: 2006

Style/genre: Blues/rock mixes

Bio: Despite a love of radio since childhood, native Virginian Charlie Lukhardt came into deejaying late in life. The retired construction project manager found his new calling after sitting in on a bygone WSLR show. Nearly five years later (the anniversary's in August), the blues aficionado still shares his vast musical knowledge with listeners via two programs on Sarasota's low-powered WSLR. "Radio Gumbo" began as a blues show but has morphed, by listener demand, into what Lukhardt calls "blues-based eclectic," combining a high- energy mix of blues rock, Delta and contemporary blues, R&B, funk, Cajun, zydeco and straight-ahead rock music -- nothing below mid-tempo -- and the epitome of what Lukhardt calls a "musical gumbo." Conversely, "Hot Tea with Gumbo" airs early morning and is appropriately programmed with more moderate- and low-tempo'd fare. Lukhardt shares helming duties on this one, alternating weeks with Bryan Osgood. Fans may email requests to Lukhardt at Radiogumbo325@aol.com.

-- Dawn Scire, dawnzig@hotmail.com
